programme.title: Rise Of The Footsoldier 3
programme.desc: Notorious gangster Pat Tate rises through the ranks of Essex's criminal underworld. Prequel, starring Craig Fairbrass, Terry Stone and Roland Manookian.

programme.title: Dog Eat Dog
programme.desc: A crew of former prisoners are hired by a Cleveland crime syndicate to kidnap the baby of a rival mobster. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Willem Dafoe and Christopher Matthew Cook.

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: An assassination attempt is made on the life of the US president during a terrorism summit. The story unfolds from several perspectives, including that of the secret service agents charged with protecting the head of state, a news producer covering the event and a man in the crowd who may have caught the perpetrator on camera. Thriller, starring Dennis Quaid, Matthew Fox, Forest Whitaker, Sigourney Weaver and William Hurt.

programme.title: Sam Churchill: Search for a Homeless Man
programme.desc: A seemingly straightforward missing persons case draws a private investigator into a battle against the members of a child pornography ring, who are holding a teenager he has been hired to find. Thriller, starring John Schneider, Robyn Lively, Alex Rocco and Rudy Ramos.

programme.title: Scribe
programme.desc: A recovering alcoholic finds himself at the centre of a political conspiracy after he accepts a shady job transcribing calls from tapped phones. Thriller, starring Francois Cluzet, Denis Podalydes and Sami Bouajila. In French.

programme.title: Hitman
programme.desc: A genetically engineered assassin, who exists at the beck and call of a mysterious organisation, fails in his latest mission, and becomes a target himself, as security forces worldwide become aware of his existence and a rival agent is assigned to tie up loose ends. Action thriller, starring Timothy Olyphant, Dougray Scott and Olga Kurylenko.

programme.title: The Godfather: Part III
programme.desc: Twenty years after ordering the murder of his brother, ageing don Michael Corleone is close to fulfilling his dream of severing his family's Mafia ties and gaining legitimacy, but vengeful enemies and the actions of his hot-headed nephew soon draw him back into a life of crime. Conclusion of Francis Ford Coppola's crime drama trilogy, starring Al Pacino, Andy Garcia, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Eli Wallach, Bridget Fonda and Joe Mantegna.

programme.title: Baby Driver
programme.desc: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver with tinnitus takes part in a heist doomed to fail. Edgar Wright's music-themed action thriller, starring Ansel Elgort, Kevin Spacey and Jon Hamm.

programme.title: City of Tiny Lights
programme.desc: A hard-drinking private detective searches for a missing sex worker, leading to a dangerous world of religious fanaticism and political intrigue. London-set crime thriller from Dredd director Pete Travis, starring Riz Ahmed, Billie Piper and James Floyd.

programme.title: Safe House
programme.desc: A CIA agent stationed in South Africa is sent to question a rogue operative, who has been arrested years after betraying the agency, only to be attacked by mercenaries hired to capture the fugitive. As they flee for their lives, the interrogator has to contend with not only the enemies hunting them, but also the mind games of his prisoner. Thriller, with Denzel Washington and Ryan Reynolds.

programme.title: Baby Driver
programme.desc: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver with tinnitus takes part in a heist doomed to fail. Edgar Wright's music-themed action thriller, starring Ansel Elgort, Kevin Spacey and Jon Hamm.

programme.title: Brawl In Cell Block 99
programme.desc: A former boxer is blackmailed into performing a prison hit by a ruthless drug kingpin. Crime thriller, starring Vince Vaughn, Jennifer Carpenter and Don Johnson.

programme.title: The Juror
programme.desc: A mobster threatens to have a juror's son murdered if she fails to persuade the other 11 members of the jury to return a verdict of not guilty in the trial of a Mafia kingpin. Psychological thriller, starring Demi Moore, Alec Baldwin, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, James Gandolfini and Anne Heche.

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: A suave ex-convict assembles a gang of sophisticated crooks to pull off a daring heist. He intends to rob three of Las Vegas's biggest casinos simultaneously - and also win back his estranged wife, who is now dating the ruthless owner of all three gambling establishments. Steven Soderbergh's crime comedy, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Bernie Mac.

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: A philosophy-reading kung fu expert gains a reputation as the best bouncer around, and is hired by the owner of a rowdy Missouri bar to keep the peace. When he fires some of the establishment's corrupt staff, he incurs the wrath of a local crime boss who has a stranglehold on the town's businesses. Action thriller, starring Patrick Swayze, Ben Gazzara, Kelly Lynch, Sam Elliott and blues singer Jeff Healey.

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.

programme.title: The Resident
programme.desc: Left alone to care for her baby in a creepy apartment, a new mother begins to learn unsettling details about the building's violent past. Psychological horror-thriller, starring Tianna Nori, Mark Matechuk and Krista Madison.

programme.title: Detour
programme.desc: A troubled LA law student drunkenly commits to a revenge plot against his stepfather. Crime thriller, starring Tye Sheridan, Emory Cohen and Bel Powley.

programme.title: The Hatton Garden Job
programme.desc: A ragtag group of career criminals plot an audacious, multi-million-pound raid on an underground facility in London. True-life crime drama, with Stephen Moyer, Larry Lamb and Matthew Goode.

programme.title: The Sting
programme.desc: Two conmen decide to swindle a mobster out of a fortune in revenge for the murder of a mutual friend. Enlisting the help of a host of crooks, they quickly conjure up a brilliant scheme to make him pay for his crime. Oscar-winning Depression-era comedy drama, starring Robert Redford, Paul Newman, Robert Shaw, Charles Durning and Eileen Brennan.

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: A smart-mouthed PR executive answers a public phone and the caller on the other end warns him that if he hangs up he will be shot. The unseen gunman then puts his target through a tortuous series of mind games, as well as incriminating him in the death of a bystander. Psychological thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Kiefer Sutherland, Katie Holmes and Forest Whitaker.

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: A driverless train carrying a deadly cargo of toxic chemicals goes out of control. A veteran train operator and his rookie colleague set off in pursuit in their own locomotive, intending to bring it to a halt before it crashes and causes a major disaster. Action thriller, the final film from director Tony Scott, starring Denzel Washington, Chris Pine and Rosario Dawson.

programme.title: Anon
programme.desc: In a world without anonymity or crime, a detective meets a woman who threatens their security. Sci-fi thriller from Gattaca and In Time director Andrew Niccol, starring Clive Owen, Amanda Seyfried and Colm Feore.

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Twentysomething gun runners David Packouz and Efraim Diveroli win a $300million contract from the Pentagon to arm America's allies in Afghanistan. Fact based comedy-drama, starring Miles Teller, Jonah Hill and Bradley Cooper.

programme.title: The Sting
programme.desc: Two conmen decide to swindle a mobster out of a fortune in revenge for the murder of a mutual friend. Enlisting the help of a host of crooks, they quickly conjure up a brilliant scheme to make him pay for his crime. Oscar-winning Depression-era comedy drama, starring Robert Redford, Paul Newman, Robert Shaw, Charles Durning and Eileen Brennan.

programme.title: Money Train
programme.desc: A New York cop in debt to loan sharks persuades his foster brother and fellow police officer to rob a train carrying all the day's takings from the city's subway network. However, things start to go wrong when a female detective creates rivalry between the pair, and a pyromaniac serial killer threatens their plans. Action comedy, starring Woody Harrelson, Wesley Snipes, Jennifer Lopez and Chris Cooper.

programme.title: Marathon Man
programme.desc: A college undergraduate training for a marathon is drawn into a shady world of espionage by his secret agent brother and a Nazi war criminal searching for a cache of stolen diamonds - entangling the student in a plot involving kidnap, torture and political intrigue. John Schlesinger's thriller, starring Dustin Hoffman, Laurence Olivier and Roy Scheider. Based on the novel by William Goldman.(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: A smart-mouthed PR executive answers a public phone and the caller on the other end warns him that if he hangs up he will be shot. The unseen gunman then puts his target through a tortuous series of mind games, as well as incriminating him in the death of a bystander. Psychological thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Kiefer Sutherland, Katie Holmes and Forest Whitaker.(n)

programme.title: Angel Flight Down
programme.desc: A mercy mission runs into difficulty when the plane commissioned to airlift a sick girl suffers engine trouble and crashes on the edge of a cliff. Drama, starring Patricia Kalember and David Charvet.(n)

programme.title: Dick Tracy
programme.desc: An incorruptible Chicago cop launches a relentless campaign to stop a ruthless gangster plotting to take control of the city. But the detective finds himself distracted by the attentions of a seductive nightclub singer and a faceless vigilante playing both sides against the middle. Comic-strip adventure, directed by and starring Warren Beatty, with Madonna, Al Pacino and Dustin Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Inside Man
programme.desc: A police hostage negotiator is called in when a robbery turns into a siege. The chairman of the bank involved is worried the mastermind behind the heist is set to disclose secrets he needs to stay hidden, so he enlists the help of a political fixer. However, the elaborate nature of the thief's plan looks set to keep him one step ahead of the law, and causes problems for the detective assigned to rectify the situation. Spike Lee's thriller, with Denzel Washington, Clive Owen, Jodie Foster, Christopher Plummer, Willem Dafoe and Chiwetel Ejiofor.(n)

programme.title: Southern Fury
programme.desc: When his brother falls foul of a ruthless mobster, a straight-laced man calls on his old friend and cop to help out. Crime thriller, starring Adrian Grenier, John Cusack and Nicolas Cage.(n)

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: FBI agent Gretchen Blair finds herself caught in the middle of an elaborate mid-air heist. Thriller, starring Denise Richards, Dolph Lundgren and Chuck Liddell.(n)

programme.title: Eliminators
programme.desc: A former federal agent in the witness protection programme is forced to come out of hiding and go on the run. Thriller, starring Scott Adkins, Stu Bennett and Daniel Caltagirone.(n)

programme.title: Unforgettable
programme.desc: A woman sets out to make life a living hell for her ex-husband's new fiancee. Thriller, starring Rosario Dawson, Katherine Heigl and Geoff Stults.(n)

programme.title: Inconceivable
programme.desc: A mother looks to escape her abusive past by moving to a new town. There she befriends another mother, who grows suspicious of her. Thriller, starring Gina Gershon, Faye Dunaway and Nicolas Cage.(n)

programme.title: The Snowman
programme.desc: Detective Harry Hole investigates the disappearance of a woman whose scarf is found wrapped around an ominous-looking snowman. Crime drama based on the Jo Nesbo novel, starring Michael Fassbender, Rebecca Ferguson and Charlotte Gainsbourg.(n)

programme.title: Inside Man
programme.desc: A police hostage negotiator is called in when a robbery turns into a siege. The chairman of the bank involved is worried the mastermind behind the heist is set to disclose secrets he needs to stay hidden, so he enlists the help of a political fixer. However, the elaborate nature of the thief's plan looks set to keep him one step ahead of the law, and causes problems for the detective assigned to rectify the situation. Spike Lee's thriller, with Denzel Washington, Clive Owen, Jodie Foster, Christopher Plummer, Willem Dafoe and Chiwetel Ejiofor.(n)

programme.title: Sudden Death
programme.desc: Terrorists seize control of an ice-hockey stadium in the middle of a match attended by the US vice president. Taking the politician hostage, they threaten to blow up the building at the final whistle - but a resourceful former fireman takes it upon himself to thwart their dastardly plot. Action thriller, starring Jean-Claude Van Damme, Powers Boothe, Raymond J Barry and Whittni Wright.(n)

programme.title: To Kill a King
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the English Civil War, King Charles I has been imprisoned and his fate now hangs in the balance. However, the decision over whether to have him executed or show mercy divides revolutionary leaders Fairfax and Cromwell, while in parliament, plans are afoot to make a deal with the deposed monarch. Historical drama, starring Tim Roth, Dougray Scott and Rupert Everett.

programme.title: Doctor Dolittle
programme.desc: A Victorian veterinary surgeon is certified insane after developing the ability to talk to his patients in their own language. Undaunted, he manages to escape from the asylum and embarks on a quest to locate a rare aquatic snail. Oscar-winning musical comedy, with Rex Harrison, Samantha Eggar, Richard Attenborough and Anthony Newley. Songs include Talk to the Animals and I've Never Seen Anything Like It.

programme.title: The Tale of the Princess Kaguya
programme.desc: An elderly bamboo cutter finds a tiny princess in a glowing shoot, little realising she will grow up to be a beautiful, strong-willed woman. After receiving several marriage proposals, she sets her suitors a variety of challenges in an attempt to learn which of them deserves to win her heart. Animated fantasy, featuring the voices of Chloe Grace Moretz, James Caan and Mary Steenburgen.

programme.title: First Daughter
programme.desc: The daughter of the US president is determined to lead a normal life and manages to persuade him to let her enrol at college as a normal student. However, she is unaware her father has hired a young special agent to go undercover at the same college - which creates a dilemma when she falls in love with him. Romantic comedy, starring Katie Holmes, Marc Blucas, Michael Keaton and Amerie.

programme.title: Transcendence
programme.desc: A scientist working to develop artificial intelligence is assassinated, but his death provides the breakthrough he and his colleagues needed, as his own mind is uploaded into a computer system. Granted extraordinary knowledge, he begins planning to change the world for the better - with potentially horrific consequences for the human race. Sci-fi drama, starring Johnny Depp, Rebecca Hall and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: A deskbound CIA agent provides valuable background support for a dashing secret agent, but has never gone into action herself. Everything changes, when the spy mysteriously vanishes, and she leaps into action to take his place, infiltrating the inner circle of a ruthless arms dealer and trying to avert a global catastrophe. Comedy adventure, starring Melissa McCarthy, Jason Statham and Rose Byrne.

programme.title: The Keeping Room
programme.desc: Premiere. Three women living on an isolated farm during the American Civil War must defend their home from renegade soldiers. Western, starring Brit Marling and Hailee Steinfeld.

programme.title: The Tree of Life
programme.desc: A boy living in 1950s Texas grows up to become a disillusioned adult. On the anniversary of his brother's death, he questions his relationship with his stern father, his place in the modern world and the meaning of human existence. Terrence Malick's drama, starring Brad Pitt, Sean Penn, Hunter McCracken and Jessica Chastain.

programme.title: The Rugrats Movie
programme.desc: Tommy tries to return his new brother to the baby shop, helped by Angelica, Chuckie, Phil and Lil - but the friends become lost in dense woodlands en route, turning their expedition into a scary and exciting journey of discovery. Animated comedy based on the TV series, with the voices of Elizabeth Daily, Christine Cavanaugh, Kath Soucie, Whoopi Goldberg and Busta Rhymes.

programme.title: The Jane Austen Book Club
programme.desc: Two women organise a book club devoted to reading and discussing Jane Austen novels. But the members - including a woman abandoned by her husband and a reluctant lovesick sci-fi fan - discover their own love lives are beginning to mirror the plots of her books in unexpected ways. Romantic comedy, starring Kathy Baker, Maria Bello, Emily Blunt, Amy Brenneman, Maggie Grace and Hugh Dancy.

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: A socially inept high-school student and his lonely unemployed brother find their eccentric home life thrown into upheaval when their meddling uncle comes to stay. The teenage oddball tries to make the best of his changing circumstances, while putting all his skills to the task of helping his new best friend win the class presidency. Comedy, starring Jon Heder, Efren Ramirez and Haylie Duff.

programme.title: Short Circuit
programme.desc: A military robot is struck by lightning and develops a mind of its own. The machine embarks on a series of comic misadventures, but the company that made him wants him back. He realises his only hope is to convince the scientist who invented him that he really is alive. Sci-fi comedy adventure, starring Steve Guttenberg, Ally Sheedy and Fisher Stevens.

programme.title: The Eagle
programme.desc: A Roman centurion seeks to restore his father's honour by recovering the standard of a legion that disappeared. Accompanied by his British slave, he makes a dangerous journey north of Hadrian's Wall into the Scottish Highlands, territory occupied by hostile tribes. Action adventure, starring Channing Tatum, Jamie Bell, Mark Strong and Donald Sutherland.

programme.title: Die Hard 4.0
programme.desc: Tough New York cop John McClane is sent to escort a computer hacker to Washington for questioning. During this routine operation he stumbles on a criminal mastermind's plan to launch a technological terrorist attack on the US, and is forced to enlist the hacker's aid in foiling the evil scheme. Action thriller sequel, with Bruce Willis, Timothy Olyphant, Justin Long and Maggie Q.

programme.title: This Is 40
programme.desc: A couple wrestle with a series of crises as their 40th birthdays loom on the horizon, turning to friends and family for help in coping with the challenges of work, parenthood, age and debt. Comedy, starring Paul Rudd and Leslie Mann reprising their roles from Knocked Up. With Megan Fox, Albert Brooks and John Lithgow.

programme.title: Black Mountain Poets
programme.desc: Lisa and Claire Walker go on the run after bodging the attempted theft of a JCB from an industrial estate and end up stealing a car belonging to Alys and Terri Wilding, performance poets who were on their way to a competition and retreat in the Brecon Beacons. Lisa and Claire adopt the sisters' identities and decide to lie low at the event until the heat has died down. Comedy drama, starring Alice Lowe and Dolly Wells.(n)

programme.title: Magic in the Water
programme.desc: Two children investigate the legend of a mythical creature rumoured to live in the lake by their holiday home. They are astonished when they discover the monster and find it is actually quite friendly - and is eager to help the children thwart a company dumping toxic waste in the water. Family adventure, starring Mark Harmon, Joshua Jackson and Harley Jane Kozak.(n)

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie
programme.desc: The plucky sea creature sets out to prove his boss Mr Krabs is innocent of stealing Neptune's crown. However, the missing item has ended up in sinister Shell City, which all sea-dwellers fear and from which few have ever returned. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny, Bill Fagerbakke, Clancy Brown and Scarlett Johansson, plus a cameo appearance by David Hasselhoff.(n)

programme.title: Spy Kids 4: All the Time in the World
programme.desc: A secret agent decides to retire after having a baby, while her two stepchildren remain completely unaware of her exciting past. They stumble on to the truth when she is recalled to duty and, with the aid of two former junior spies, they help battle an evil mastermind who has the power to control time. Family adventure, starring Jessica Alba, Jeremy Piven, Rowan Blanchard and Mason Cook.(n)

programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Jess befriends a new girl at school, and the pair begin to create their own imaginary kingdom in a secret place in the woods to escape the difficulties of their real lives. Unfortunately, a tragedy threatens to bring their fantasy world to an end. Drama based on Katherine Paterson's novel, starring Josh Hutcherson, AnnaSophia Robb, Zooey Deschanel and Robert Patrick.(n)

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the franchise.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt and his team are implicated in a bombing at the Kremlin, forcing the American president to declare them fugitives. The spies plan to clear their name by abducting the real terrorist, which leads them into a pursuit around the globe. However, Hunt cannot be sure his colleagues are trustworthy. Action adventure sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg and Paula Patton.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A cousin of the family arrives with her baby, having left her husband whom she believes is being unfaithful.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Mary Ellen needs help studying for her medical training, so offers to help a nurse as she treats a dying woman.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Nellie and Percival await the imminent birth of their first baby, but the local townsfolk are too busy arguing about the child's religious future to join in the celebrations.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Almanzo's brother Royal leaves his two kids with the Wilders while he and his wife take a well-earned holiday, but the youngsters prove to be quite a handful.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd faces a malpractice suit from a high-risk pregnancy patient and begins to doubt her decision to end her therapy sessions. Joanie and Phil go on a purely platonic date - but soon find their feelings getting in the way of their friendship. Ashley Johnson and Isabella Hoffman guest star.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd feels oppressed in the aftermath of the malpractice suit and Jim returns to full-time work under Sam's watchful eye. Tina seeks professional advice about childbirth, and learns she may have to undergo surgery to conceive.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Vietnam veteran Joe Mason tries to get government assistance with expensive dental work. However, because his condition is not related to his military service, he is denied, leaving him struggling to raise the money.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Ronald James, a respected reporter and anti-drug advocate, is shocked to come home and find out that his son has turned him into the police for cocaine addiction.

programme.title: To Live For
programme.desc: A terminally ill woman's last months are made happier by her relationship with a stranger she hopes will take care of her children. Romantic drama, starring Nancy Travis, Scott Bairstow, Jamie Renee Smith, Karen James and Viveka Davis.

programme.title: Bringing Ashley Home
programme.desc: When Libba Phillips' troubled younger sister Ashley suddenly goes missing, she sets out to locate her sibling and bring her home. As the years go by, Libba's resolve remains true, at the expense of her marriage and her career. However, personal loss does not deter her from the mission, and she finds a new calling in life creating a resource centre for the families of other people who have falled through the cracks. Fact-based drama, starring AJ Cook.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The children prepare a surprise party for John and Olivia's 25th wedding anniversary, while their parents have surprises of their own in store.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: While collecting insects for a school project, Laura and Mary become annoyed at Carrie as she lets the bugs escape, but worry when the youngster wanders off and goes missing.

programme.title: The Cry
programme.desc: Part one of two. Psychological thriller about a bereaved mother who becomes obsessed with another woman's baby. Still grieving over her own loss, child protection officer Meg Bartlet befriends new mother Christine Rearden, but the relationship turns sour when Meg sets out to prove baby Eleanor's breathing problems are the result of abuse. Starring Sarah Lancashire, Emma Cunniffe, Anthony Calf, James Laurenson and Joe Duttine.

programme.title: The Cry
programme.desc: Part two of two. Meg's abduction of Eleanor hits the headlines, forcing her to go on the run under an assumed name. She breaks into Christine's family home and poses as a journalist in the hope of uncovering evidence of child abuse. Psychological thriller, starring Sarah Lancashire, Emma Cunniffe and Anthony Calf.

programme.title: The Great Los Angeles Earthquake
programme.desc: A pioneering seismologist predicts an earthquake is about to strike the city, sending citizens into a blind panic as they scramble to avoid death and destruction. Disaster drama, starring Joanna Kerns, Dan Lauria, Ed Begley Jr and Richard Masur.

programme.title: No Way Out
programme.desc: A navy officer unwittingly has an affair with a politician's mistress, and becomes involved in the investigation after she is murdered. However, he soon suspects the plan is to find a scapegoat rather than the real killer - and that he is the most likely candidate to take the fall. Political thriller, starring Kevin Costner, Gene Hackman, Sean Young, Iman and George Dzundza.

programme.title: No Way Out
programme.desc: A navy officer unwittingly has an affair with a politician's mistress, and becomes involved in the investigation after she is murdered. However, he soon suspects the plan is to find a scapegoat rather than the real killer - and that he is the most likely candidate to take the fall. Political thriller, starring Kevin Costner, Gene Hackman, Sean Young, Iman and George Dzundza.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A famous novelist is found dead in a city alley the morning after a glamorous book launch. As the police investigate, they find the victim enjoyed a secret life amid Glasgow's sleazy underworld - and had an obsessive fan who may have been driven to murder. With Blythe Duff.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben decides to assert his independence, but finds the only job he can get is working for his father's rival.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A car accident leaves Olivia, Elizabeth and Jim-Bob stranded, and they get lost in the woods while pursuing an escaped chicken.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Farmer Joe Kagan is distraught to find out that Hester Sue, the woman he gave up everything to be with, is engaged to someone else, so he takes it upon himself to change her mind.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura quits her teaching job, leaving the children to face the tender mercies of Mrs Oleson, who immediately sets about making changes to the curriculum.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd meets her attorney to discuss the malpractice suit, but a clash of egos puts her defence in jeopardy when she realises he is even more stubborn than she is. George Newbern guest stars.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd's efforts to help a gang member result in her being implicated in a shooting, and she worries that this further brush with the law can only harm her case in the impending malpractice suit. Drama, starring Milina Kanakarades and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark come to the aid of an old friend who cannot afford to support himself and care for his comatose son. Eli Wallach guest stars.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: A young man with no particular direction in life has a breakdown after finding out that the girl he is in love with is pregnant.

programme.title: Romance on the Orient Express
programme.desc: An American travelling by train from Venice to Paris bumps into her former lover, and the pair try to understand why their initial romance ended so abruptly. Romantic drama, starring Cheryl Ladd and Stuart Wilson.

programme.title: The Reading Room
programme.desc: A wealthy retired businessman sets out to fulfil his wife's dying wish to create a free establishment where illiterate people from a deprived community can learn to read. However, despite his best intentions, social problems in the crime-riddled neighbourhood look set to threaten the project. Drama, starring James Earl Jones, Kathryne Dora Brown, Joanna Cassidy and Monique Coleman.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason helps Verdie investigate her family history, while Elizabeth writes to a soldier serving in the war - but she tells him she is 18 and sends him a picture of Erin.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary and Laura hear a loud argument the night before Halloween, and become convinced they have witnessed the murder of Mrs Oleson. Drama, starring Melissa Sue Anderson and Melissa Gilbert.

programme.title: Million Dollar Murder
programme.desc: A wealthy couple's idyllic life is torn apart when the wife becomes severely paranoid. Matters come to a head when she falsely accuses her husband of adultery. He finally snaps and asks her to move out - prompting her to persuade a smitten builder to help do away with him. Fact-based drama, with Poppy Montgomery, David Sutcliffe, Shawn Christian and Maxim Roy.

programme.title: Murder at Devil's Glen
programme.desc: An ex-convict stirs up unwanted memories on his return home, leading a group of outwardly respectable friends to make a deadly decision to prevent him revealing dark secrets from their past. Thriller, starring Rick Schroder, Jayce Bartok, Jack Noseworthy and Michael Easton.

programme.title: The Great Los Angeles Earthquake
programme.desc: A pioneering seismologist predicts an earthquake is about to strike the city, sending citizens into a blind panic as they scramble to avoid death and destruction. Disaster drama, starring Joanna Kerns, Dan Lauria, Ed Begley Jr and Richard Masur.

programme.title: 4 Minute Mile
programme.desc: A troubled teenager years to escape his deprived background and difficult home life through his skills as an athlete, but lacks the discipline to make something of himself. He discovers a reclusive, embittered neighbour is a former athletics coach, and together they try and help each other triumph over their personal issues. Drama, starring Kelly Blatz, Richard Jenkins and Kim Basinger.

programme.title: Prophet's Prey
programme.desc: Documentary about former Mormon fundamentalist leader Warren Jeffs, who held a dictatorial rule over his followers before being convicted of sexual assault on children.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob worries about how different he looks from his brothers and sisters, and begins to wonder if John and Olivia really are his parents.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben starts to hunt animals for their skins to sell for profit. John-Boy organises a reenactment of a famous historical battle, leaving Grandpa ashamed, as he has exaggerated his own part in the actual event.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Albert falls for a traumatised schoolgirl hiding a terrible secret, but her father tries to put a stop to their relationship, forcing them to meet in secret.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Albert helps Sylvia to run away so she will not have to leave Walnut Grove with her father, but unknowingly reveals her whereabouts to the rapist.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd sets off with Joanie to deliver a speech to a group of medical students in Los Angeles, leading to a chance encounter with a former boyfriend. Drama, starring Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd continues to feel like her life is adrift after being banned from practicing medicine. Morgan Fairchild guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: A lonely female novelist is in love with a legendary spy hero who has been dead for 20 years. She buys his sports car in an auction only to find out that his ghost comes with the car.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: A selfish tycoon is given the chance to make amends for the pollution his company has been causing for years. Leslie Nielsen guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Unanswered Prayers
programme.desc: A former football star returns to his Virginia small town and joins the family building firm, but his family happiness with his wife and son is suddenly tested by the return of his first high-school love. Drama, starring Eric Close, Samantha Mathis and Madchen Amick.(n)

programme.title: Five
programme.desc: Anthology of five short films telling the stories of women whose lives are affected by breast cancer from the initial diagnosis, and examining the way their condition changes how they view themselves and their relationships with others. Drama, with Patricia Clarkson, Rosario Dawson, Jeanne Tripplehorn, Ava Acres, Ginnifer Goodwin and Lyndsy Fonseca.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ben and Jim-Bob feel guilty after their carelessness causes Elizabeth to break both her legs.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: Journey in the Spring - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Charles Ingalls receives the sad news that his mother has died, and must travel back to where he grew up to persuade his father to come and live with him in Walnut Grove.(n)

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: A battered wife with three children is persuaded by her sister to leave her abusive husband, but he continues to subject her to a barrage of harassment and threats - until the situation culminates in a fatal confrontation that changes the lives of all involved. Drama, starring Isabella Hofmann, Seth Adkins, Tracy Nelson and Matt Cooke.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: A medical student tries to solve a murder, but her family and friends believe she is having a breakdown and only imagined the killing. Thriller, starring Katheryn Winnick and Nicolas Wright.(n)

programme.title: Jack Hunter: The Lost Treasure of Ugarit
programme.desc: A heroic archaeologist journeys to Syria to uncover the truth behind the murder of his mentor, but finds himself pursued through Egypt and Turkey in search of ancient treasure. Adventure, the first in a trilogy of films, starring Ivan Sergei and Joanne Kelly.(n)

programme.title: Anna Nicole
programme.desc: Biopic of Anna Nicole Smith, charting the rise of her successful modelling career and headline-grabbing marriage to an elderly billionaire. Following her husband's death, she is consumed by alcoholism and drug addiction as she desperately tries to maintain the celebrity status she has acquired. Biopic of Anna Nicole Smith, starring Agnes Bruckner and Martin Landau.(n)

programme.title: A Death in Canaan
programme.desc: A kind-hearted community comes to the aid of a teenager who is accused of murdering his mother. Drama, starring Stefanie Powers, Paul Clemens, Tom Atkins and Jacqueline Brookes.(n)

programme.title: Beyond the Blackboard
programme.desc: A newly qualified teacher sets up a makeshift classroom for homeless teenagers. Initially afraid and suspicious of her students, she gradually gets to know them and becomes determined to make a difference to their difficult lives. Fact-based drama, starring Emily VanCamp, Steve Talley and Treat Williams.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A cousin of the family arrives with her baby, having left her husband whom she believes is being unfaithful.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Mary Ellen needs help studying for her medical training, so offers to help a nurse as she treats a dying woman.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Nellie and Percival await the imminent birth of their first baby, but the local townsfolk are too busy arguing about the child's religious future to join in the celebrations.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Almanzo's brother Royal leaves his two kids with the Wilders while he and his wife take a well-earned holiday, but the youngsters prove to be quite a handful.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd faces a malpractice suit from a high-risk pregnancy patient and begins to doubt her decision to end her therapy sessions. Joanie and Phil go on a purely platonic date - but soon find their feelings getting in the way of their friendship. Ashley Johnson and Isabella Hoffman guest star.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd feels oppressed in the aftermath of the malpractice suit and Jim returns to full-time work under Sam's watchful eye. Tina seeks professional advice about childbirth, and learns she may have to undergo surgery to conceive.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Vietnam veteran Joe Mason tries to get government assistance with expensive dental work. However, because his condition is not related to his military service, he is denied, leaving him struggling to raise the money.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Ronald James, a respected reporter and anti-drug advocate, is shocked to come home and find out that his son has turned him into the police for cocaine addiction.

programme.title: To Live For
programme.desc: A terminally ill woman's last months are made happier by her relationship with a stranger she hopes will take care of her children. Romantic drama, starring Nancy Travis, Scott Bairstow, Jamie Renee Smith, Karen James and Viveka Davis.

programme.title: Bringing Ashley Home
programme.desc: When Libba Phillips' troubled younger sister Ashley suddenly goes missing, she sets out to locate her sibling and bring her home. As the years go by, Libba's resolve remains true, at the expense of her marriage and her career. However, personal loss does not deter her from the mission, and she finds a new calling in life creating a resource centre for the families of other people who have falled through the cracks. Fact-based drama, starring AJ Cook.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The children prepare a surprise party for John and Olivia's 25th wedding anniversary, while their parents have surprises of their own in store.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: While collecting insects for a school project, Laura and Mary become annoyed at Carrie as she lets the bugs escape, but worry when the youngster wanders off and goes missing.

programme.title: The Cry
programme.desc: Part one of two. Psychological thriller about a bereaved mother who becomes obsessed with another woman's baby. Still grieving over her own loss, child protection officer Meg Bartlet befriends new mother Christine Rearden, but the relationship turns sour when Meg sets out to prove baby Eleanor's breathing problems are the result of abuse. Starring Sarah Lancashire, Emma Cunniffe, Anthony Calf, James Laurenson and Joe Duttine.

programme.title: The Cry
programme.desc: Part two of two. Meg's abduction of Eleanor hits the headlines, forcing her to go on the run under an assumed name. She breaks into Christine's family home and poses as a journalist in the hope of uncovering evidence of child abuse. Psychological thriller, starring Sarah Lancashire, Emma Cunniffe and Anthony Calf.

programme.title: The Great Los Angeles Earthquake
programme.desc: A pioneering seismologist predicts an earthquake is about to strike the city, sending citizens into a blind panic as they scramble to avoid death and destruction. Disaster drama, starring Joanna Kerns, Dan Lauria, Ed Begley Jr and Richard Masur.

programme.title: No Way Out
programme.desc: A navy officer unwittingly has an affair with a politician's mistress, and becomes involved in the investigation after she is murdered. However, he soon suspects the plan is to find a scapegoat rather than the real killer - and that he is the most likely candidate to take the fall. Political thriller, starring Kevin Costner, Gene Hackman, Sean Young, Iman and George Dzundza.

programme.title: No Way Out
programme.desc: A navy officer unwittingly has an affair with a politician's mistress, and becomes involved in the investigation after she is murdered. However, he soon suspects the plan is to find a scapegoat rather than the real killer - and that he is the most likely candidate to take the fall. Political thriller, starring Kevin Costner, Gene Hackman, Sean Young, Iman and George Dzundza.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A famous novelist is found dead in a city alley the morning after a glamorous book launch. As the police investigate, they find the victim enjoyed a secret life amid Glasgow's sleazy underworld - and had an obsessive fan who may have been driven to murder. With Blythe Duff.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben decides to assert his independence, but finds the only job he can get is working for his father's rival.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A car accident leaves Olivia, Elizabeth and Jim-Bob stranded, and they get lost in the woods while pursuing an escaped chicken.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Farmer Joe Kagan is distraught to find out that Hester Sue, the woman he gave up everything to be with, is engaged to someone else, so he takes it upon himself to change her mind.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura quits her teaching job, leaving the children to face the tender mercies of Mrs Oleson, who immediately sets about making changes to the curriculum.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd meets her attorney to discuss the malpractice suit, but a clash of egos puts her defence in jeopardy when she realises he is even more stubborn than she is. George Newbern guest stars.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd's efforts to help a gang member result in her being implicated in a shooting, and she worries that this further brush with the law can only harm her case in the impending malpractice suit. Drama, starring Milina Kanakarades and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark come to the aid of an old friend who cannot afford to support himself and care for his comatose son. Eli Wallach guest stars.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: A young man with no particular direction in life has a breakdown after finding out that the girl he is in love with is pregnant.

programme.title: Romance on the Orient Express
programme.desc: An American travelling by train from Venice to Paris bumps into her former lover, and the pair try to understand why their initial romance ended so abruptly. Romantic drama, starring Cheryl Ladd and Stuart Wilson.

programme.title: The Reading Room
programme.desc: A wealthy retired businessman sets out to fulfil his wife's dying wish to create a free establishment where illiterate people from a deprived community can learn to read. However, despite his best intentions, social problems in the crime-riddled neighbourhood look set to threaten the project. Drama, starring James Earl Jones, Kathryne Dora Brown, Joanna Cassidy and Monique Coleman.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason helps Verdie investigate her family history, while Elizabeth writes to a soldier serving in the war - but she tells him she is 18 and sends him a picture of Erin.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary and Laura hear a loud argument the night before Halloween, and become convinced they have witnessed the murder of Mrs Oleson. Drama, starring Melissa Sue Anderson and Melissa Gilbert.

programme.title: Million Dollar Murder
programme.desc: A wealthy couple's idyllic life is torn apart when the wife becomes severely paranoid. Matters come to a head when she falsely accuses her husband of adultery. He finally snaps and asks her to move out - prompting her to persuade a smitten builder to help do away with him. Fact-based drama, with Poppy Montgomery, David Sutcliffe, Shawn Christian and Maxim Roy.

programme.title: Murder at Devil's Glen
programme.desc: An ex-convict stirs up unwanted memories on his return home, leading a group of outwardly respectable friends to make a deadly decision to prevent him revealing dark secrets from their past. Thriller, starring Rick Schroder, Jayce Bartok, Jack Noseworthy and Michael Easton.

programme.title: The Great Los Angeles Earthquake
programme.desc: A pioneering seismologist predicts an earthquake is about to strike the city, sending citizens into a blind panic as they scramble to avoid death and destruction. Disaster drama, starring Joanna Kerns, Dan Lauria, Ed Begley Jr and Richard Masur.

programme.title: 4 Minute Mile
programme.desc: A troubled teenager years to escape his deprived background and difficult home life through his skills as an athlete, but lacks the discipline to make something of himself. He discovers a reclusive, embittered neighbour is a former athletics coach, and together they try and help each other triumph over their personal issues. Drama, starring Kelly Blatz, Richard Jenkins and Kim Basinger.

programme.title: Prophet's Prey
programme.desc: Documentary about former Mormon fundamentalist leader Warren Jeffs, who held a dictatorial rule over his followers before being convicted of sexual assault on children.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob worries about how different he looks from his brothers and sisters, and begins to wonder if John and Olivia really are his parents.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben starts to hunt animals for their skins to sell for profit. John-Boy organises a reenactment of a famous historical battle, leaving Grandpa ashamed, as he has exaggerated his own part in the actual event.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Albert falls for a traumatised schoolgirl hiding a terrible secret, but her father tries to put a stop to their relationship, forcing them to meet in secret.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Albert helps Sylvia to run away so she will not have to leave Walnut Grove with her father, but unknowingly reveals her whereabouts to the rapist.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd sets off with Joanie to deliver a speech to a group of medical students in Los Angeles, leading to a chance encounter with a former boyfriend. Drama, starring Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd continues to feel like her life is adrift after being banned from practicing medicine. Morgan Fairchild guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: A lonely female novelist is in love with a legendary spy hero who has been dead for 20 years. She buys his sports car in an auction only to find out that his ghost comes with the car.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: A selfish tycoon is given the chance to make amends for the pollution his company has been causing for years. Leslie Nielsen guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Unanswered Prayers
programme.desc: A former football star returns to his Virginia small town and joins the family building firm, but his family happiness with his wife and son is suddenly tested by the return of his first high-school love. Drama, starring Eric Close, Samantha Mathis and Madchen Amick.(n)

programme.title: Five
programme.desc: Anthology of five short films telling the stories of women whose lives are affected by breast cancer from the initial diagnosis, and examining the way their condition changes how they view themselves and their relationships with others. Drama, with Patricia Clarkson, Rosario Dawson, Jeanne Tripplehorn, Ava Acres, Ginnifer Goodwin and Lyndsy Fonseca.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ben and Jim-Bob feel guilty after their carelessness causes Elizabeth to break both her legs.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: Journey in the Spring - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Charles Ingalls receives the sad news that his mother has died, and must travel back to where he grew up to persuade his father to come and live with him in Walnut Grove.(n)

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: A battered wife with three children is persuaded by her sister to leave her abusive husband, but he continues to subject her to a barrage of harassment and threats - until the situation culminates in a fatal confrontation that changes the lives of all involved. Drama, starring Isabella Hofmann, Seth Adkins, Tracy Nelson and Matt Cooke.(n)

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: A medical student tries to solve a murder, but her family and friends believe she is having a breakdown and only imagined the killing. Thriller, starring Katheryn Winnick and Nicolas Wright.(n)

programme.title: Jack Hunter: The Lost Treasure of Ugarit
programme.desc: A heroic archaeologist journeys to Syria to uncover the truth behind the murder of his mentor, but finds himself pursued through Egypt and Turkey in search of ancient treasure. Adventure, the first in a trilogy of films, starring Ivan Sergei and Joanne Kelly.(n)

Biopic of Anna Nicole Smith, starring Agnes Bruckner and Martin Landau.(n)

programme.title: Russia Investigation
programme.desc: Our Cartoon President tries to survive the Russia investigation with Steve Mnuchin's help while Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer fire up Democrats with a new message.

programme.desc: Comedian Sacha Baron Cohen explores the diverse individuals, from the infamous to the unknown across the political and cultural spectrum, who populate our unique nation. Series premiere.

programme.title: War Horse
programme.desc: From legendary director Steven Spielberg comes an epic adventure: a tale of incredible loyalty, hope, and tenacity. Based on the Tony® Award-winning Broadway play, and set against the sweeping canvas of World War I, this deeply heartfelt story begins with the remarkable friendship between a horse named Joey and his young trainer Albert. When they're forced apart by war, we follow Joey's extraordinary journey as he changes and inspires the lives of everyone he meets. Starring Emily Watson and David Thewlis.

programme.title: Swing Away
programme.desc: Following a meltdown that leads to a suspension, professional golfer Zoe Papadopoulos travels to her grandparents' village in Greece to escape the harsh spotlight of the international sports world. Between baking bread and eating baklava, she meets and mentors a ten-year-old girl who is determined to become the next golf sensation. Along the way, Zoe rediscovers her Greek heritage, her love of the game and the hidden strength within herself.

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Follows the extraordinary life of college football hero Ernie Davis (Rob Brown), the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy. His fight for equality forever changed the face of American sports. Based on a true story.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: A wedding is about to take place in Chinquapin, Louisiana. The bride is Shelby (Julia Roberts), a headstrong young beauty whose iron-willed mother, M'Lynn (Sally Field), would do anything for her. Giant-haired Dolly Parton is Truvy, the owner of the beauty parlor that serves as the town's unofficial hub. Dropping in to exchange gossip are Ouiser (Shirley MacLaine), the richest and meanest woman in town, and Clairee (Olympia Dukakis), an elegant widow with a sly delivery. Together they provide each other with strength and friendship.

programme.title: The Big Chill
programme.desc: Seven college housemates from the 1960s who have drifted apart must now reunite for the funeral of a friend. Having entered adulthood as non-conformists, most now belong to the establishment. Harold (Kevin Kline) has grown up to be a running-shoe magnate; Michael (Jeff Goldblum), a gossip magazine journalist; Sam (Tom Berenger), TV's hottest private eye; and Nick (William Hurt), a drug dealer. Among the women, Sarah (Glenn Close) is a doctor; Meg (Mary Kay Place), a lawyer; and Karen (Jobeth Williams), a wife and mother in the suburbs.

programme.title: The Stepford Wives
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman, Matthew Broderick and Christopher Walken star in this satirical remake of the classic thriller about a planned community where the picture-perfect women are a little too eerily flawless. Glenn Close, Bette Midler, Jon Lovitz and Roger Bart costar in this wickedly acerbic comedy from writer Paul Rudnick ("Addams Family Values," "In & Out").

programme.title: Confessions of A Teenage Drama Queen
programme.desc: Lindsay Lohan stars as Lola, whose family moves from the center of everything in New York City to the center of a cultural wasteland in suburban New Jersey. She feels her life is simply not worth living, but no matter who or what gets in the way, Lola won't give up on her life's ambition to be a star.

programme.title: Bad Moms
programme.desc: Over-worked, over-committed and exhausted, Amy joins forces with two other stressed moms on a quest to liberate themselves from conventional responsibilities - going on a long overdue binge of freedom and fun that puts them on a collision course with the head of the PTA and her clique of perfect moms.

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
programme.desc: Captain Jack Sparrow has a blood debt to pay. He owes his soul to the ghastly Davy Jones unless he can cheat death - and eternal damnation - by seizing the fabled Dead Man's Chest. Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom and Keira Knightley star.

programme.title: The Girl On The Train
programme.desc: Rachel, who is devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day. One morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds. Emily Blunt, Lisa Kudrow, Justin Theroux and Allison Janney star.

programme.title: Sleepless
programme.desc: When Las Vegas cop Vincent Downs (Jamie Foxx) and his partner Sean (Tip "T.I." Harris) rob a cocaine shipment bound for a drug-dealing casino boss (Dermot Mulroney), the desperate businessman retaliates by kidnapping Vincent's son (Octavius J. Johnson). Pursued by a dogged Internal Affairs investigator (Michelle Monaghan) and a sadistic drug kingpin (Scoot McNairy), Vincent must rely on his street smarts and sheer force of will as he tries to rescue his child over the course of a single night. Directed by Baran bo Odar.

programme.title: Christine
programme.desc: High school geek Arnie Cunningham falls in love with Christine, a bright red 1957 Plymouth Fury which has seen much better days. After restoring the car to its original condition, his friends notice that the car is not the only thing that is changing. Arnie seems to spend more and more time with his car. He's also developed a cocky arrogance which does not seem like the real Arnie at all.

programme.title: The Space Between Us
programme.desc: Shortly after arriving to help colonize Mars, an astronaut dies while giving birth to the first human born on the red planet, unable to reveal who the father is. The child, Gardner Elliot, is an inquisitive, highly intelligent boy who reaches the age of 16 having only met 14 people in his life. While searching for clues about his father, and the home planet he's never known, Gardner begins an online friendship with a street-smart girl named Tulsa. He arrives on Earth, eager to experience all of the wonders he's only read about.

programme.title: Sleepless
programme.desc: When Las Vegas cop Vincent Downs (Jamie Foxx) and his partner Sean (Tip "T.I." Harris) rob a cocaine shipment bound for a drug-dealing casino boss (Dermot Mulroney), the desperate businessman retaliates by kidnapping Vincent's son (Octavius J. Johnson). Pursued by a dogged Internal Affairs investigator (Michelle Monaghan) and a sadistic drug kingpin (Scoot McNairy), Vincent must rely on his street smarts and sheer force of will as he tries to rescue his child over the course of a single night. Directed by Baran bo Odar.

programme.title: Soul Men
programme.desc: Estranged backup singers reluctantly embark on a trip to New York where they are to perform in honor of their late band leader, but long-simmering resentments and grudges threaten to scuttle their reunion in this comedy drama starring Samuel L. Jackson and Bernie Mac with Jennifer Coolidge.

programme.title: Changeling
programme.desc: Academy Award winner Clint Eastwood directs this drama in which Academy Award winner Angelina Jolie's kidnapped son is found alive. She realizes that the child returned to her is not her own. She faces corrupt police and a skeptical public in her relentless pursuit of answers, only to be confronted by a truth that will change her forever. Set in 1920s Los Angeles, the film also stars Academy Award nominee John Malkovich.

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: All of San Francisco is taken hostage when a vengeful general (Ed Harris) seizes control of Alcatraz Island, threatening to launch missiles loaded with deadly poison gas. With time running out, only a young FBI chemical weapons expert (Nicolas Cage) and a notorious federal prisoner (Sean Connery) have the skills to penetrate the island fortress and defuse the situation.

programme.title: Baby Driver
programme.desc: A talented young getaway driver (Ansel Elgort) relies on the beat of his personal soundtrack to be the best in the game. When he meets the girl of his dreams (Lily James), Baby sees a chance to ditch his criminal life and make a clean getaway. But after being coerced into working for a crime boss (Kevin Spacey), he must face the music when a doomed heist threatens his life, love and freedom.(n)
