programme.title: Terms of Endearment
programme.desc: Hard-to-please Aurora (Shirley MacLaine) is looking for love, while her daughter (Debra Winger) has her own set of family problems. Also starring Jack Nicholson.(n)

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: Eight strangers with eight different points of view try to unlock the truth behind an assassination attempt on the president of the United States. Thomas Barnes (Dennis Quaid) and Kent Taylor (Mathew Fox) are two Secret Service agents assigned to protect President Ashton (William Hurt) at a landmark summit on the global war on terror. When President Ashton is shot moments after his arrival in Spain, chaos ensues and disparate lives collide in the hunt for the assassin.(n)

programme.title: The Preacher's Wife
programme.desc: Denzel Washington stars as an angel named Dudley sent to Earth to help a minister's marriage (Courtney B. Vance) to his wife (Whitney Houston). Things take a twist when Dudley accidentally falls in love with her.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeats
programme.desc: A feisty American hip hop dancer travels to India with her family for a wedding and falls in love - both with a new style of dance, and with the determined young man who introduces it to her.(n)

programme.title: Shanghai Noon
programme.desc: The Wild West meets the Far East in a battle for honor, royalty and gold when acrobatic Chinese Imperial Guard Chon Wang (Jackie Chan) comes to America to rescue beautiful Princess Pei Pei (Lucy Liu) who has been kidnapped from The Forbidden City. With the help of a partner he doesn't trust (Owen Wilson), a wife he didn't expect (Brandon Merrill), a horse with a personality all its own and martial arts moves no one can believe, Chon finds himself facing the meanest gunslingers in the West.(n)

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: Ben Affleck takes over the role of hero CIA agent Jack Ryan in this box office hit based on the best-selling novel by Tom Clancy. Low-level analyst Ryan is elevated to prominence by his expertise on an obscure strongman (Ciaran Hinds) after the politician's surprising ascendancy to the Russian presidency. But that's just the tip of a very large, very lethal iceberg involving neo-Nazis and a nuclear warhead smuggled into the U.S. by terrorists. Morgan Freeman, Bridget Moynihan and Liev Schreiber costar in this espionage adventure.(n)

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: Eight strangers with eight different points of view try to unlock the truth behind an assassination attempt on the president of the United States. Thomas Barnes (Dennis Quaid) and Kent Taylor (Mathew Fox) are two Secret Service agents assigned to protect President Ashton (William Hurt) at a landmark summit on the global war on terror. When President Ashton is shot moments after his arrival in Spain, chaos ensues and disparate lives collide in the hunt for the assassin.(n)

programme.title: Willard
programme.desc: Willard Stiles (Bruce Davison) is a young man who lives alone with his mother. His boss is a vulgar, cruel man who is working Willard to death at his factory job. Lonely, depressed and isolated, Willard is on the verge of a breakdown when he makes a new friend: Ben, one of the many rats who live in his dilapidated home. Not only can Willard communicate with the rodent, but he can actually command him to do his bidding. Using Ben and his friends as instruments of retaliation, Willard commands his pets to carry out his vengeance.

programme.title: Christine
programme.desc: High school geek Arnie Cunningham falls in love with Christine, a bright red 1957 Plymouth Fury which has seen much better days. After restoring the car to its original condition, his friends notice that the car is not the only thing that is changing. Arnie seems to spend more and more time with his car. He's also developed a cocky arrogance which does not seem like the real Arnie at all.

programme.title: The Golden Child
programme.desc: As The Chosen One, Eddie Murphy is on a madcap mission to save The Golden Child, a youth with mystical powers who's been abducted by an evil cult. He battles a band of henchmen, scrambles through a booby-trapped chamber of horrors and traverses Tibet to obtain a sacred dagger. But it's his wit that turns out to be his sharpest weapon.

programme.title: Pet
programme.desc: Psychological thriller about a lonely man who bumps into an old crush and subsequently becomes obsessed with her, leading him to hold her captive underneath the animal shelter where he works. But she is not who she seems to be - and his reason to lock her up may not be as crazy as originally thought.

programme.title: Willard
programme.desc: Willard Stiles (Bruce Davison) is a young man who lives alone with his mother. His boss is a vulgar, cruel man who is working Willard to death at his factory job. Lonely, depressed and isolated, Willard is on the verge of a breakdown when he makes a new friend: Ben, one of the many rats who live in his dilapidated home. Not only can Willard communicate with the rodent, but he can actually command him to do his bidding. Using Ben and his friends as instruments of retaliation, Willard commands his pets to carry out his vengeance.

programme.title: Christine
programme.desc: High school geek Arnie Cunningham falls in love with Christine, a bright red 1957 Plymouth Fury which has seen much better days. After restoring the car to its original condition, his friends notice that the car is not the only thing that is changing. Arnie seems to spend more and more time with his car. He's also developed a cocky arrogance which does not seem like the real Arnie at all.

programme.title: A.R.C.H.I.E.
programme.desc: A recently orphaned 15-year-old who has moved to a small town to live with her uncle befriends a robotic canine with super strength, x-ray vision and the ability to talk and the pair take on a military complex, bullies, kidnappers, romance and the world.

programme.title: Dudes & Dragons
programme.desc: When a powerful wizard is jilted by a princess, he vows to rid the land of love and commands a fire breathing dragon to destroy any sign of affection seen throughout the kingdom but as the death toll rises, a brave and arrogant warrior and his estranged brother answer the princess’ call to fight the curse.

programme.title: Cursed to Kill
programme.desc: Rachel awakens in a hospital, paralyzed from the waist down after a failed attempt on her life for abandoning a cult suicide. Her suffering grows as the spirits of the deceased members begin to haunt her within the confines of the hospital room. They threaten to kill her unless she is willing to offer up a kindred soul in place of her own - her brother's child. But the week that Rachel is given to make her decision is tethered to a curse. All who have the misfortune of hearing anything she says are met with a swift and violent death.

programme.title: The Babadook
programme.desc: Six years after the violent death of her husband, Amelia (Essie Davis) is at a loss. She struggles to discipline her out-of-control son, Samuel (Noah Wiseman), who she finds impossible to love. Samuel's dreams are plagued by a monster he believes is coming to kill them both. When a disturbing storybook turns up at their house, Samuel is convinced that the Babadook is the creature he's been dreaming about. His hallucinations spiral out of control, he becomes more unpredictable and violent.

programme.title: Contracted
programme.desc: Samantha (Townsend) is a twenty‐something party girl with little discipline and even less direction. After experiencing a lapse in her relationship with her lover (Stegeman), she's forced to move back in with her overbearing mother (Williams). Things take a turn for the worse when she spends the night with a mysterious man (Barrett), leaving her hung‐over and guilt‐ridden. However, something else is wrong with Samantha and she's infected. Unsure of the disease, she realizes she is the host of something catastrophic.

programme.title: Dream House
programme.desc: Daniel Craig and Academy Award winner Rachel Weisz star as a couple that unknowingly moves into a New England home where several grisly murders were committed, only to become the killer's next target. Academy Award nominee Naomi Watts stars as a neighbor who knew the previous family - a family whose gruesome story could be horrific foreshadowing of the present family's demise. Directed by the Academy Award nominee Jim Sheridan.

programme.title: Don't Knock Twice
programme.desc: A successful sculptor named Jess returns to the UK to rebuild her relationship with Chloe, the daughter she was forced to give up nine years ago. When she agrees to come and live with her, Jess learns that Chloe has not come to stay because she wants to get to know her mother again. She has come because she is scared that a supernatural curse has claimed the life of her boyfriend, Danny, and is now coming for her. Chloe and Danny made the mistake of visiting an abandoned house once home to a witch, that comes for you if you knock on the door.

programme.title: 7 Guardians of the Tomb
programme.desc: A team of scientists made up of Jia (Li Bingbing), Ridley (Kellan Lutz), and Mason (Kelsey Grammer) are in search for a lost colleague in an ancient labyrinth. Before it's too late, the group must battle their way through a swarm of deadly, man-eating funnel web spiders and find out what is behind the arachnids' power and intelligence used to protect a secret powerful elixir.

programme.title: The Babadook
programme.desc: Six years after the violent death of her husband, Amelia (Essie Davis) is at a loss. She struggles to discipline her out-of-control son, Samuel (Noah Wiseman), who she finds impossible to love. Samuel's dreams are plagued by a monster he believes is coming to kill them both. When a disturbing storybook turns up at their house, Samuel is convinced that the Babadook is the creature he's been dreaming about. His hallucinations spiral out of control, he becomes more unpredictable and violent.

programme.title: Dream House
programme.desc: Daniel Craig and Academy Award winner Rachel Weisz star as a couple that unknowingly moves into a New England home where several grisly murders were committed, only to become the killer's next target. Academy Award nominee Naomi Watts stars as a neighbor who knew the previous family - a family whose gruesome story could be horrific foreshadowing of the present family's demise. Directed by the Academy Award nominee Jim Sheridan.

programme.title: Attack of the Lederhosen Zombies
programme.desc: When a scientific experiment unleashes an epidemic of zombies in the Alps, a trio of snowboarders find themselves in a battle for survival where they must use their snowboarding skills to defeat the aprés-ski undead once and for all.

programme.title: Zombie Honeymoon
programme.desc: When a beach-front encounter with a zombie during their honeymoon results in a groom with a taste for human flesh, a newlywed bride tries to make the best of a rapidly deteriorating situation in this romantic horror comedy starring Tracy Coogan and Graham Sibley.

programme.title: Dude Bro Party Massacre III
programme.desc: Brent enters the halls of the Delta Bi Theta fraternity. He isn't just any pledge, he's a legacy - and it's a legacy of death. Brent is actually there to solve the mystery of his identical twin brother Brock's murder, and he'll do anything to crack the case, including an attempt at the frat's most daring prank of all time. After the prank causes two commercial jets to collide over an orphanage, they're punished to a weekend at The Old Sorority House by the Lake. But they're not the only ones there, a killer named Motherface lurks nearby.

programme.title: Cursed to Kill
programme.desc: Rachel awakens in a hospital, paralyzed from the waist down after a failed attempt on her life for abandoning a cult suicide. Her suffering grows as the spirits of the deceased members begin to haunt her within the confines of the hospital room. They threaten to kill her unless she is willing to offer up a kindred soul in place of her own - her brother's child. But the week that Rachel is given to make her decision is tethered to a curse. All who have the misfortune of hearing anything she says are met with a swift and violent death.

programme.title: Bang Bang Baby
programme.desc: In this dreamy sci-fi musical set in the 1960s, an isolated small town teenager believes her hopes of becoming a famous singer will come true when her rock star idol gets stranded in town and romance blooms between them but a leak in a nearby chemical plant threatens to turn her dream into a nightmare.

programme.title: The Host
programme.desc: When an unseen enemy threatens mankind by taking over their bodies and erasing their memories, Melanie (Saoirse Ronan) risks everything to protect the people she loves — her friends, her brother and her Uncle Jeb (William Hurt).

programme.title: Gambler's Ballad: The Legend of Johnny Thompson
programme.desc: This film explores one of the greatest magicians and magic minds in history, Johnny Thompson. He teaches fellow magician Penn Jillette his signature piece called Gambler's Ballad.

programme.title: The Caretaker
programme.desc: When a young woman moves into a large Victorian home to become the caretaker to her aging, sickly grandmother, she soon finds herself sleepwalking and having strange visions and is forced to confront her family's darkest secrets before the evil presence in the house overtakes her sanity.

programme.title: Rabid
programme.desc: After a young woman has a motorcycle accident that leads to experimental surgery to save her life, she develops a taste for blood that spurs a city-wide zombie epidemic.

programme.title: Extraterrestrial
programme.desc: A group's getaway into the woods dissolves into a full-throttle fight for their lives when unwelcome aliens invade.

programme.title: At the Devil's Door
programme.desc: When ambitious young real estate agent Leigh is asked to sell a house with a checkered past, she crosses paths with a disturbed girl whom she learns is the runaway daughter of the couple selling the property. Leigh tries to intervene and help her, but becomes entangled with a supernatural force that pulls Leigh's sister Vera into its web, and has sinister plans for both of them. Starring Naya Rivera, Ashley Rickards and Catalina Sandino Moreno.

programme.title: The Host
programme.desc: When an unseen enemy threatens mankind by taking over their bodies and erasing their memories, Melanie (Saoirse Ronan) risks everything to protect the people she loves — her friends, her brother and her Uncle Jeb (William Hurt).

programme.title: Skybound
programme.desc: Five plane passengers are unable to land after a gigantic disaster happens on the ground.

programme.title: Ratpocalypse
programme.desc: American Senator John Perryman (Casper Van Dien) delivers a fiery speech in Moscow about the country's main evil - corruption. A corruption so pervasive it will turn men into rats. He declares that he was ordered to speak to them from above and threatens everyone with the loss of their human form, which draws only guffaws and resentment from the people. Many take the Senator for a madman. Eventually the Senator meets a mysterious girl in the streets, and everything he talked about in Moscow begins to come true, triggering panic.(n)

programme.title: Attack of the Killer Donuts
programme.desc: A chemical accident turns ordinary donuts into bloodthirsty monsters and three friends must track them down as they begin eating their victims. It's up to them to destroy the donuts and save their sleepy little town.(n)

programme.title: Black Christmas (1974)
programme.desc: Classic slasher film in which a group of sorority sisters are stalked by an unwelcome guest during the Christmas break.(n)

programme.title: The Funhouse Massacre
programme.desc: On Halloween night, a group of notorious serial killers escape from an asylum and terrorize the patrons of a funhouse carnival - leaving only a rag-tag bunch of kids, a clueless deputy and a local sheriff to stop the carnage.(n)

programme.title: Stake Land
programme.desc: When an epidemic of vampirism strikes and his family is slaughtered, young Martin (Connor Paolo) is taken under the wing of a grizzled, wayward hunter (Nick Damici) whose new prey are the undead. Simply known as Mister, the vampire stalker takes Martin on a journey through the locked-down towns of America's heartland, searching for a better place to call home while taking down any bloodsuckers that cross their path.(n)

programme.title: Ratpocalypse
programme.desc: American Senator John Perryman (Casper Van Dien) delivers a fiery speech in Moscow about the country's main evil - corruption. A corruption so pervasive it will turn men into rats. He declares that he was ordered to speak to them from above and threatens everyone with the loss of their human form, which draws only guffaws and resentment from the people. Many take the Senator for a madman. Eventually the Senator meets a mysterious girl in the streets, and everything he talked about in Moscow begins to come true, triggering panic.(n)

programme.title: King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table
programme.desc: Facing defeat, Merlin banishes the evil enchantress Morgana and her son to the ends of universe. Vowing revenge, Morgana and her son return to Earth, hell-bent on destroying every last descendant of King Arthur and his Knights.(n)

programme.title: The Space Between Us
programme.desc: Shortly after arriving to help colonize Mars, an astronaut dies while giving birth to the first human born on the red planet, unable to reveal who the father is. The child, Gardner Elliot, is an inquisitive, highly intelligent boy who reaches the age of 16 having only met 14 people in his life. While searching for clues about his father, and the home planet he's never known, Gardner begins an online friendship with a street-smart girl named Tulsa. He arrives on Earth, eager to experience all of the wonders he's only read about.(n)

programme.title: Willard
programme.desc: Willard Stiles (Bruce Davison) is a young man who lives alone with his mother. His boss is a vulgar, cruel man who is working Willard to death at his factory job. Lonely, depressed and isolated, Willard is on the verge of a breakdown when he makes a new friend: Ben, one of the many rats who live in his dilapidated home. Not only can Willard communicate with the rodent, but he can actually command him to do his bidding. Using Ben and his friends as instruments of retaliation, Willard commands his pets to carry out his vengeance.(n)

programme.title: The Eyes
programme.desc: When six strangers with unspeakable pasts wake up imprisoned in an abandoned warehouse, they discover they are being forced to participate in an evil experiment. Five of them must die, only one can live and they have two hours to decide amongst themselves who survives. The clock is ticking and if they don't decide, they will all die.(n)

programme.title: Reeker
programme.desc: A group of disparate strangers including a blind genius and a druggie who ripped off his ecstasy dealer converges on a small, abandoned town where they are promptly slaughtered one at a time by a grotesque and extremely foul-smelling creature. Devon Gummersall, Derek Richardson and Tina Illman star in this tongue-in-cheek horror flick.(n)

programme.title: The Golden Child
programme.desc: As The Chosen One, Eddie Murphy is on a madcap mission to save The Golden Child, a youth with mystical powers who's been abducted by an evil cult. He battles a band of henchmen, scrambles through a booby-trapped chamber of horrors and traverses Tibet to obtain a sacred dagger. But it's his wit that turns out to be his sharpest weapon.(n)

programme.title: The Space Between Us
programme.desc: Shortly after arriving to help colonize Mars, an astronaut dies while giving birth to the first human born on the red planet, unable to reveal who the father is. The child, Gardner Elliot, is an inquisitive, highly intelligent boy who reaches the age of 16 having only met 14 people in his life. While searching for clues about his father, and the home planet he's never known, Gardner begins an online friendship with a street-smart girl named Tulsa. He arrives on Earth, eager to experience all of the wonders he's only read about.(n)

programme.title: Max Steel
programme.desc: Teenager Max McGrath moves back to Copper Canyon, the town where his scientist father died under mysterious circumstances. Adjusting to a new school is not easy for Max, and it becomes even more complicated when his body starts to generate strange energy flare-ups that he can't control. This unpredictable power surge grows too intense for Max to handle and he is forced to distance himself from those around him. On the brink of fatal combustion, Max is rescued by Steel, an extraterrestrial who has been secretly monitoring his progress.(n)

programme.title: Employee of the Month (2006)
programme.desc: A slacker box boy (Dane Cook) at a New Mexico superstore tries to impress a gorgeous new coworker (Jessica Simpson) by transforming himself into a model corporate drone, but runs up against the previous 17-time holder (Dax Shepard) of the store's "employee of the month" honor.

programme.title: The Big Chill
programme.desc: Seven college housemates from the 1960s who have drifted apart must now reunite for the funeral of a friend. Having entered adulthood as non-conformists, most now belong to the establishment. Harold (Kevin Kline) has grown up to be a running-shoe magnate; Michael (Jeff Goldblum), a gossip magazine journalist; Sam (Tom Berenger), TV's hottest private eye; and Nick (William Hurt), a drug dealer. Among the women, Sarah (Glenn Close) is a doctor; Meg (Mary Kay Place), a lawyer; and Karen (Jobeth Williams), a wife and mother in the suburbs.

programme.title: Bad Ass
programme.desc: A shunned Vietnam veteran who becomes a local hero after saving a man from attackers on a city bus decides to take action when his best friend is murdered and the police show little interest in solving the crime.

programme.title: Slow Burn (2007)
programme.desc: A district attorney who's running for mayor suddenly finds himself embroiled in a case of murder and financial corruption in this edgy thriller starring Ray Liotta, LL Cool J, Jolene Blalock, Mekhi Phifer, Taye Diggs and Chewitel Ejiofor.

programme.title: Jimmy Vestvood: Amerikan Hero
programme.desc: Satire about a bumbling Iranian immigrant who wins the green card lottery and moves to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of becoming an American hero and unwittingly becomes embroiled in a conspiracy to start the next world war.

programme.title: King Arthur
programme.desc: An adventure that tells the true story of Arthur (Clive Owen) and his bond of brotherhood with Lancelot (Ioan Gruffudd) and the Knights Of The Round Table as they fight for freedom and those they love. Co-starring Keira Knightley.

programme.title: Jenny's Wedding
programme.desc: Jenny Farrell has led an openly gay life with everyone except her family. She has kept it a secret out of compassion for her parents, knowing they are happiest living in a small, safe and familiar world. Realizing she is missing out on having a full life, Jenny decides to marry Kitty, a woman they thought was her roommate. Her parents are shocked to find out how little they know their daughter and fear becoming the object of gossip in their small community. Misunderstanding leads to misunderstanding, and long-standing grudges are revealed.

programme.title: Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius
programme.desc: A ten-year-old genius inventor must rally his neighborhood pals to build an armada of spaceships and rescue their parents from a goopy alien race in time for dinner in this computer-animated box office blockbuster from Nickelodeon. Featuring the voices of Martin Short, Andrea Martin and Patrick Stewart.

programme.title: Prison Fighters: 5 Rounds to Freedom
programme.desc: A SHOWTIME feature-length documentary following two men in Thailand's modern day Prison Fight program, where convicted criminals are given the chance to fight for their release - and possible redemption, too - through the ancient tradition of Muay Thai matches.
Returning to his hometown, US Marine Nelson Sanchez finds himself trapped by the violent past he had tried to escape.

programme.title: Mrs McCutcheon
programme.desc: Having always felt he was born in the wrong body, 10-year-old Tom chooses the name Mrs McCutcheon rather than the name he was given at birth; he also prefers the flow of a dress rather than the cut of a pant. Now at his third school, Tom is having trouble settling in and finding acceptance from his newfound peers - except for Trevor, a tough little charmer who also suffers prejudice due to his Aboriginal heritage.

programme.title: A Better Life
programme.desc: Carlos Galindo (Demian Bichir) dreamed of good things for his wife and son when they crossed the border into the US. After his wife leaves him, Carlos' only goal was to make sure his son Luis was given the opportunities he never had. After years of hard work, he still finds himself drifting apart from Luis, now a teenager, who is susceptible to peer pressures. Carlos borrows what little money he can and invests it all into his own gardening business, hoping to finally achieve the better life he always envisioned for his son.

programme.title: The Space Between Us
programme.desc: Shortly after arriving to help colonize Mars, an astronaut dies while giving birth to the first human born on the red planet, unable to reveal who the father is. The child, Gardner Elliot, is an inquisitive, highly intelligent boy who reaches the age of 16 having only met 14 people in his life. While searching for clues about his father, and the home planet he's never known, Gardner begins an online friendship with a street-smart girl named Tulsa. He arrives on Earth, eager to experience all of the wonders he's only read about.

programme.title: Bad Grandmas
programme.desc: Senior citizens Mimi, Bobbi, Virginia and Coralee quietly live out their twilight years in Southern Missouri playing cards and baking cakes. Bobbi's son-in-law, Jim, cons her into losing her house and Mimi, the unofficial leader of the group, decides to take matters into her own hands. Things spin out of control when she confronts Jim and he accidentally gets killed in the altercation.

programme.title: I, Daniel Blake
programme.desc: Daniel Blake (Dave Johns) is a man out of time. He's a widowed woodworker who's never owned a computer and lives according to his own common sense moral code. After a heart attack leaves him unable to work and the state welfare system fails him, Daniel must stand up and fight for his dignity and lead a one-man crusade for compassion that transforms the lives of a single mother (Hayley Squires) and her two children.

programme.title: Wolves
programme.desc: Anthony (Taylor John Smith) is a standout player on his high school's basketball team with everything going for him: a killer three-point shot, a loving girlfriend (Zazie Beetz) and a chance at a scholarship to Cornell. But Anthony's dreams of playing college ball are jeopardized by his volatile father (Michael Shannon), a hard-drinking writer whose compulsive gambling threatens to derail the lives of both his wife (Carla Gugino) and son. Anthony must summon the strength to step out from his father's shadow and reclaim his future.

programme.title: So Here's The Thing ...
programme.desc: Hank tries to set things right with Karen but his multiple romantic entanglements become ever more entangled; Becca calls out her father on the terrible example he sets for her; Charlie fights to keep Sue's favorite client.(c)

programme.title: The Apartment
programme.desc: A night of hedonistic abandon with one of his students and a pair of strippers ends badly when Hank is besieged by Charlie, an angry Rick Springfield, two of his other lovers, and his boss - resulting in an epic showdown.(c)

programme.title: The Flying Scotsman
programme.desc: This inspiring sports drama is the true story of Scottish bicyclist Graeme Obree, who broke the world one-hour cycling record in 1993 on a bicycle he designed and built from scrap metal and washing machine parts. Jonny Lee Miller, Laura Fraser, Brian Cox and Billy Boyd costar.

programme.title: B&B
programme.desc: Marc and Fred go to war when they are refused a double bed at a Christian B&B. They win their court case and go back. Triumph turns to terror when a Russian neo-Nazi checks in. Their weekend of fun becomes a bloody battle.

programme.title: Bad Girl
programme.desc: Amy must fight to save her adoptive parents from their self-styled vengeful blood daughter, Chloe.

programme.title: Bowling for Columbine
programme.desc: Director and star Michael Moore stirred up controversy and won an Oscar® with this dissection of America's fascination with firearms, a skillful work of agitprop that is by turns infuriating, disturbing and hilarious as the rotund host gets a free gun with his new bank account, pays an impromptu visit to NRA chief Charlton Heston, and visits K-Mart with survivors of the Columbine High School shootings.

programme.title: Disgraced
programme.desc: A SHOWTIME feature-length documentary examining the 2003 murder of college basketball star Patrick Dennehy by teammate Carlton Dotson, and the subsequent accusations against both Baylor University and head coach Dave Bliss.

programme.title: Knockin' on Dave's Door
programme.desc: Music legend Bob Dylan flies to London one day to visit his mate Dave Stewart. After getting lost, Bob finally arrives at the address and finds himself waiting for Dave in his flat dutifully being served tea by his girlfriend. But is he really in the right place? Starring Eddie Marsan, Paul Ritter and Katherine Parkinson.

programme.title: Different Flowers
programme.desc: Uptight Millie Haven (Emma Bell) has always followed the rules, but when she has doubts before her big Kansas City wedding, her attitude-prone little sister Emma (Hope Lauren), comes to the rescue. They embark on a spontaneous road trip to their grandmother's farm where, with the help of Grandma Mildred (Shelley Long), they rediscover their bond. They meet a local hunk with a heart of gold, and a host of only-in-the-Midwest characters as they pick up the pieces of Millie's life.

programme.title: You, Me and Him
programme.desc: Two female lovers, one a career driven lawyer (Lucy Punch), the other a fun-loving, pot-smoking layabout (Faye Marsay), have an annoying Casanova neighbor (David Tennant). While neither woman ever wanted children, both end up pregnant, creating conflicts that cause each to re-examine their outlook on life and their relationship.

programme.title: The Hallow
programme.desc: Adam Hitchens is a London-based conservationist, husband and father who has found himself struggling amidst fraught economic pressures at work. He decides to move his family from London to Ireland and to take a job surveying an Irish forest. He moves his family to a millhouse deep in the idyllic countryside of Ireland. When the family arrives, they get to work rebuilding their new home. They meet their neighbors, but not everyone approves of their arrival. The locals are unfriendly and begin to make them feel unwanted.

programme.title: The Free World
programme.desc: After spending two decades in prison for a crime he didn't commit, Mo (Boyd Holbrook) struggles to put his past behind him and readjust to a new life. Doris (Elisabeth Moss) is trapped in another sort of prison: an abusive marriage. When a dramatic encounter brings them together, Mo soon finds himself risking everything—including being locked up once again for someone else's crime—to protect the fragile Doris. Academy Award® winner Octavia Spencer and Sung Kang costar.

programme.title: Personal Shopper
programme.desc: By day, American in Paris Maureen (Kristen Stewart) works as a personal shopper, motor-biking around the city buying up deluxe couture for a celebrity client. By night, she attempts to channel the spirits of the dead, hoping to make contact with her recently deceased twin brother. When Maureen begins receiving a series of chilling, increasingly sinister text messages, it seems she may have made contact - but she doesn't know with whom.

programme.title: The Edge of Seventeen
programme.desc: Nadine (Hailee Steinfeld) and Krista (Haley Lu Richardson) are inseparable best friends attempting to navigate high school together, until Nadine's older brother Darian (Blake Jenner) and Krista begin dating. With her view of the world rocked, Nadine is forced to see the people in her life, including her well-meaning but distracted mother (Kyra Sedgwick), and unlikely mentor and History teacher Mr. Bruner (Woody Harrelson), with fresh eyes and new appreciation. She realizes that people - and life - are more complicated than she thought.

programme.title: The Golden Child
programme.desc: As The Chosen One, Eddie Murphy is on a madcap mission to save The Golden Child, a youth with mystical powers who's been abducted by an evil cult. He battles a band of henchmen, scrambles through a booby-trapped chamber of horrors and traverses Tibet to obtain a sacred dagger. But it's his wit that turns out to be his sharpest weapon.

programme.title: Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: I'm Still Laughing
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Bill Bellamy hosts this installment of Shaquille O'Neal's comedy franchise. Featuring comedy veteran Bruce Bruce who teams up with Huggy Lowdown, Aida Rodriguez, and Brian "Da Wildcat" Smith.(n)

programme.title: Mr. Bad Example
programme.desc: Hank's exploits with his boss's wife are exposed when Becca and Chelsea get into a campus brawl; Charlie scrambles to keep Marcy away from cocaine-addicted client Rick Springfield, jeopardizing his job.(n)

programme.title: Dogtown
programme.desc: Hank takes Charlie on a bender to console him over losing his job, but they both end up having a near-death experience during a convenience store robbery; Karen hosts Becca and Marcy on a girls night out.(n)

programme.title: Kirk Fox: That Guy
programme.desc: In this stand-up comedy special, Kirk Fox examines that guy we all wonder about who sits at the bar by himself. He covers what makes that guy tick, his frequent social faux pas and his misunderstandings with women.(n)

programme.title: Crossing Over
programme.desc: The politically charged subject of illegal immigration forms the basis of this drama starring Harrison Ford as a morally conflicted border official in love with a Mexican woman about to be deported, whose job connects him to several other aspiring citizens struggling to make their way in the U.S. Ray Liotta and Ashley Judd costar.(n)

programme.title: Godfrey: Regular Black
programme.desc: No-holds barred stand-up comedian Godfrey performs a riotous set in his hometown of Chicago.(n)

programme.title: The Art of the Steal
programme.desc: This eye-opening documentary tells the story of the Barnes Collection, $25 billion worth of masterpieces by Cezanne, Matisse and Renoir that has become the focus of a culture war between those who wish to preserve the intentions of the collection's original owner, and a conspiracy of politically powerful corporations seeking to profit by seizing and relocating the artwork.(n)

programme.title: Operation Odessa
programme.desc: This is a true crime documentary featuring a Russian mobster, a Miami playboy and a Cuban spy who sold a Soviet submarine to a Colombian drug cartel for $35 million. A mid-'90s gangster epic that hopscotches from Brooklyn to Miami and Cali to Moscow, the film tells the story of three friends who set out to hustle the Russian mob, the Cali cartel and the DEA for the score of a lifetime.(n)

programme.title: Jimmy Vestvood: Amerikan Hero
programme.desc: Satire about a bumbling Iranian immigrant who wins the green card lottery and moves to Los Angeles to pursue his dream of becoming an American hero and unwittingly becomes embroiled in a conspiracy to start the next world war.(n)

programme.title: The Truth About Lies
programme.desc: Gilby Smalls (Fran Kranz) is having a meltdown. He's just been fired from his job and his girlfriend gave him the boot. Forced to move in with May (Coleen Camp), his booze-swilling man-obsessed mother, he's desperate to turn things around. Gilby's luck seems to change when he meets Rachel (Odette Annable), the very thing Gilby needs to get his life back on track. Desperate to impress her, Gilby starts to weave a web of lies; one bigger than the next. Now in a sticky mess, Gilby is forced to face the uncomfortable truth about himself.(n)

programme.title: XTC: This is Pop
programme.desc: Emerging from the late 1970s punk and new wave explosion, XTC amasses a devoted following with hit singles like 'Making Plans For Nigel' and 'Mayor Of Simpleton'. Presenting a journey into the world of the band, the film includes newly filmed interviews with Andy Partridge, Colin Moulding, Dave Gregory and Terry Chambers. Through a mixture of animation, archive and specially-shot sequences, the film explores the minds of principle songwriters, Partridge and Moulding.(n)

programme.title: Sister
programme.desc: After the death of his father, a young man whose life is falling apart, returns to his hometown to take care of his mentally ill sister, and tries to save her, while also saving himself.(n)

programme.title: Bad Ass 3: Bad Asses on the Bayou
programme.desc: Action film series starring Danny Glover and Danny Trejo as senior heroes who visit Louisiana for a wedding escape only to encounter violence and mayhem, and once again, must pursue their own form of justice.(n)

programme.title: Band Aid
programme.desc: Anna (Zoe Lister-Jones) and Ben (Adam Pally) are a couple who can't stop fighting. Advised by their therapist to try and work through their grief unconventionally, they are reminded of their shared love of music. In a last-ditch effort to save their marriage, they decide to turn all their fights into song, and with the help of their neighbor Dave (Fred Armisen), they start a band.(n)

programme.title: Jackals
programme.desc: When Justin Powell (Ben Sullivan) is captured by two ski-masked men and dragged back to a secluded cabin, it's anything but a standard kidnapping. Waiting for Justin at the cabin are his father (Johnathon Schaech) mother (Deborah Kara Unger), brother (Nick Roux) and former girlfriend (Chelsea Ricketts). Together, they attempt to free him from the sinister brainwashing he's undergone at the hands of a vicious cult known as The Jackals.(n)

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: Brilliant medical student Michael (Oscar Isaac) meets beautiful dance instructor Ana (Charlotte Le Bon) in late 1914. Their shared Armenian heritage sparks an attraction that turns into a romantic rivalry between Michael and Ana's boyfriend (Christian Bale), an American photojournalist. As the Ottoman Empire crumbles into war-torn chaos, their conflicting passions must be put aside as they join forces to get themselves to safety.(n)

programme.title: Stolen
programme.desc: Haunted by the kidnapping and murder of his ten-year-old son, a grieving detective (Jon Hamm) seeks redemption when he investigates a fifty-year-old murder case with eerie similarities to his story. Josh Lucas and James Van Der Beek costar in this mystery thriller.

programme.title: Man On A Ledge
programme.desc: When former NYPD officer turned prison escapee Nick Cassidy (Sam Worthington) enters the famed Roosevelt Hotel on 45th and Madison in New York City, heads to one of the highest floors and steps out a window onto the ledge, he threatens more than just his own well-being. A whole city is about to seize up, including some very nervous people with some very big secrets. Elizabeth Banks, Ed Harris and Edward Burns co-star in this propulsive, twisty action thriller.

programme.title: Ghost in the Shell
programme.desc: In the near future, Major (Scarlett Johansson) is the first of her kind - a human saved from a terrible crash, who is cyber-enhanced to be a perfect soldier devoted to stopping the world's most dangerous criminals. Terrorism has reached a new level that includes the ability to hack into people's minds and control them, but Major is uniquely qualified to stop it. As she prepares to face a new enemy, Major discovers that she has been lied to: her life was not saved, it was stolen. Now she must figure out who created her.

programme.title: Season of the Witch
programme.desc: Oscar winner Nicolas Cage and Ron Perlman star in this adventure about a heroic Crusader and his fellow soldier who must transport a woman accused of being a witch to a remote monastery. The journey across perilous terrain tests their strength and courage as they discover the girl's secret and find themselves battling a powerful force that will determine the fate of the world.

programme.title: Don't Knock Twice
programme.desc: A successful sculptor named Jess returns to the UK to rebuild her relationship with Chloe, the daughter she was forced to give up nine years ago. When she agrees to come and live with her, Jess learns that Chloe has not come to stay because she wants to get to know her mother again. She has come because she is scared that a supernatural curse has claimed the life of her boyfriend, Danny, and is now coming for her. Chloe and Danny made the mistake of visiting an abandoned house once home to a witch, that comes for you if you knock on the door.

programme.title: Walking Out
programme.desc: Once a year, fourteen-year-old David (Josh Wiggins) travels from his mother's home in Texas to visit his loner father, Cal (Matt Bomer), in the remote mountains of Montana. There, the two embark on their annual hunting excursion, during which the taciturn Cal attempts to connect with his smartphone-addicted son. But when a terrifying turn of events leaves Cal critically wounded, it's up to the teenage David to summon enough strength for both of them.

programme.title: This Isn't Funny
programme.desc: Eliot is a stand up comedian with crippling anxiety, while Jamie avoids life through partying and travel. When Jamie rides his bike into Eliot's car their exchange is not exactly pleasant. Eliot then riffs on their encounter in her set that night and Jamie is there to see it. Suddenly the chemistry is undeniable. Just as they open themselves up and see they might be a fit, new job opportunities and family crises strain their relationship.

programme.title: The Light Between Oceans
programme.desc: Lighthouse keeper Tom Sherbourne (Michael Fassbender) and spirited Isabel (Alicia Vikander) live together in married bliss on a remote, rugged island off the coast of Australia. But their windswept world is turned upside down when Isabel learns that she's unable to bear a child. One day, a drifting lifeboat washes ashore with a crying baby in it. The dilemma the couple now faces echoes far beyond the island, engulfing and irrevocably impacting their world.

programme.title: The White King
programme.desc: Djata is a 12-year-old growing up in a brutal dictatorship shut off from the outside world. When the government imprisons his father and Djata and his mother are labeled traitors, the boy will not rest until he sees his father again.

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: All of San Francisco is taken hostage when a vengeful general (Ed Harris) seizes control of Alcatraz Island, threatening to launch missiles loaded with deadly poison gas. With time running out, only a young FBI chemical weapons expert (Nicolas Cage) and a notorious federal prisoner (Sean Connery) have the skills to penetrate the island fortress and defuse the situation.

programme.title: The Longshots
programme.desc: A former high school football star gets his self-respect back when he lands a job coaching the local Pop Warner team with his athletically gifted niece as quarterback. Ice Cube stars in this sports comedy with Keke Palmer and Dash Mihok.

programme.title: Soul Men
programme.desc: Estranged backup singers reluctantly embark on a trip to New York where they are to perform in honor of their late band leader, but long-simmering resentments and grudges threaten to scuttle their reunion in this comedy drama starring Samuel L. Jackson and Bernie Mac with Jennifer Coolidge.

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds
programme.desc: A squadron of vengeful, Nazi-killing Allied soldiers becomes embroiled in a plot to firebomb a Parisian movie theater hosting a film premiere that Adolf Hitler plans to attend in this comically violent World War II action smash starring Brad Pitt, Diane Kruger and Oscar® winner Christoph Waltz.

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: All of San Francisco is taken hostage when a vengeful general (Ed Harris) seizes control of Alcatraz Island, threatening to launch missiles loaded with deadly poison gas. With time running out, only a young FBI chemical weapons expert (Nicolas Cage) and a notorious federal prisoner (Sean Connery) have the skills to penetrate the island fortress and defuse the situation.

programme.title: 68 Kill
programme.desc: Trailer-dwelling, sewage-pumping Chip (Matthew Gray Gubler) has got one thing going for him: he's head over heels infatuated with his girlfriend Liza (AnnaLynne McCord). He's more than willing to overlook her wild streak—the fact that she's hooking up with their landlord; her rather extreme mood swings —so when she proposes a plot to steal $68,000, he goes along with the plan. But when what was supposed to be a simple heist turns into an off-the-rails, blood-spattered crime spree.

programme.title: Blackway
programme.desc: Revenge thriller starring Anthony Hopkins as a man haunted by the memory of his daughter's death, who comes to the aid of a young woman who is being viciously harassed by a rogue cop. Co-stars Julia Stiles and Ray Liotta.

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds
programme.desc: A squadron of vengeful, Nazi-killing Allied soldiers becomes embroiled in a plot to firebomb a Parisian movie theater hosting a film premiere that Adolf Hitler plans to attend in this comically violent World War II action smash starring Brad Pitt, Diane Kruger and Oscar® winner Christoph Waltz.

programme.title: The Art of the Steal
programme.desc: This eye-opening documentary tells the story of the Barnes Collection, $25 billion worth of masterpieces by Cezanne, Matisse and Renoir that has become the focus of a culture war between those who wish to preserve the intentions of the collection's original owner, and a conspiracy of politically powerful corporations seeking to profit by seizing and relocating the artwork.

programme.title: The Legend of Ben Hall
programme.desc: Focusing on the last nine months of Hall's life, when he's a well-established bushranger along with his accomplices, the film explores the relationships within the gang, their robberies and the details surrounding Hall's betrayal and controversial death at the hands of the police on May 5th, 1865. Starring Jack Martin.

programme.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey
programme.desc: When a displaced Indian family opens a restaurant in the south of France, just 100 feet from a Michelin star restaurant, a culinary war ensues between the two establishments. Stars Academy Award® winner Helen Mirren.

programme.title: Vicky Cristina Barcelona
programme.desc: Romantic comedy-drama about a pair of American friends (Scarlett Johansson and Rebecca Hall) who vacation together in Spain and fall under the romantic spell of Juan, a passionate artist (Javier Bardem).

programme.title: The Girl On The Train
programme.desc: Rachel, who is devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day. One morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds. Emily Blunt, Lisa Kudrow, Justin Theroux and Allison Janney star.

programme.title: Marshall
programme.desc: In 1940, long before he sits on the US Supreme Court or claimed victory in Brown v. Board of Education, Thurgood Marshall (Chadwick Boseman) is a young rabble-rousing attorney for the NAACP. Marshall explores one his greatest challenges in those early days: the case of black chauffeur Joseph Spell (Sterling K. Brown), accused by his white employer, Eleanor Strubing (Kate Hudson), of sexual assault and attempted murder.

programme.title: Episode 401
programme.desc: Sean and Beverly's Hollywood career refuses to die, as they're dragged back from London to make six more episodes of "Pucks!". Plus, Matt gets some very disturbing news about his finances while Carol once again lobbies to run the network. Season premiere.(c)

programme.title: Episode 402
programme.desc: Matt scrambles to solve his financial woes. Several networks compete for Sean and Beverly's new show. Plus, Carol must mend fences with a woman whose husband she slept with.(c)

programme.title: Episode 403
programme.desc: Sean's former writing partner turns up to wreak havoc. Merc's career is given a new lease on life. And both Matt and Carol find romance in the most unexpected places.(c)

programme.title: Episode 404
programme.desc: Sean's former writing partner tightens the screws on Sean and Beverly. Carol throws herself into a new and unexpected romance. Matt may have found an answer to both his disastrous love life and his financial woes.(c)

programme.title: Episode 405
programme.desc: Three's a crowd as Sean and Beverly are forced to consider a writing partnership with Tim, while Carol and Helen discover they have a bedfellow in common. Meanwhile, Matt receives a lucrative yet dubious invitation.(c)

programme.title: Episode 406
programme.desc: Matt spends a day at the hospital when his father undergoes heart surgery.(c)

programme.title: Episode 407
programme.desc: Sean is hurt that Matt hasn't shown any interest in his new show. Carol attempts to slow down the pace of her new relationship with Helen.(c)

programme.title: Episode 408
programme.desc: Beverly and Carol are forced to hide their friendship from an increasingly jealous Helen. Matt is caught between a financial rock and hard place: either sell the beach house or take a job as a game show host.(n)

programme.title: Episode 409
programme.desc: Beverly and Carol struggle to hide their friendship from Helen. It's show time for Matt and "The Box"! Season finale.(n)

programme.title: Love Means Zero
programme.desc: At 85 years old, Nick Bollettieri is a living legend. At his tennis academy in Florida, he raised a generation of champions. Courier. Seles. Agassi. No other coach has matched his success, his dominance or his fame. His greatness, though, came at a terrible price - broken marriages, financial ruin and a fractured relationship with his surrogate son and most cherished student, Andre Agassi. This documentary tells his story and explores the cost of his all-consuming drive for greatness. Directed and produced by Jason Kohn.(n)

programme.title: Marshall
programme.desc: In 1940, long before he sits on the US Supreme Court or claimed victory in Brown v. Board of Education, Thurgood Marshall (Chadwick Boseman) is a young rabble-rousing attorney for the NAACP. Marshall explores one his greatest challenges in those early days: the case of black chauffeur Joseph Spell (Sterling K. Brown), accused by his white employer, Eleanor Strubing (Kate Hudson), of sexual assault and attempted murder.(n)

programme.title: Our Lady Of The Assassins
programme.desc: The violent inferno of Colombia's drug capital, Medellin, plays host to Fernando (German Jaramillo), a world-weary gay writer who has returned to die after a 30-year exile. While preparing his last good-byes, Fernando falls in love with an angelic young street thug (Anderson Ballesteros), who serves as Fernando's guide to the Medellin of his youth. Vivid, darkly humorous and often mystical, Barbet Schroeder's adaptation of Fernando Vallejo's acclaimed novel was largely filmed secretly under dangerous circumstances on the streets of Medellin.(n)

programme.title: The Girl On The Train
programme.desc: Rachel, who is devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day. One morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds. Emily Blunt, Lisa Kudrow, Justin Theroux and Allison Janney star.(n)

programme.title: Lawless Range
programme.desc: Brothers Sean and Tommy Donnelly live and work in modern day Texas. Tommy has always been troubled and Sean has always been there to help him but when Tommy gets himself into debt there's not much Sean can do. The money is owed to some very dangerous people and neither Sean nor Tommy has a spare dime. At every turn, Tommy manages to find a way to exacerbate their already difficult position. The situation escalates to the point where Sean is faced with a decision: stand by his brother or give up on him once and for all.(n)

programme.title: Punching Henry
programme.desc: A journeyman comedian (Henry Phillips) is lured to L.A. by a TV producer (J.K. Simmons) who wants to make him a reality star. As reality sets in, he must decide whether his legacy will be to tell jokes for a living or become the butt of them, in this glimpse behind the weird world of comedy. Sarah Silverman, Tig Notaro, Jim Jefferies and Doug Stanhope also star.(n)

programme.title: Shifting Gears
programme.desc: Tom is a hard-working manager at a big box super store. He started in the stock room, always imagining himself at the helm. Now poised for a big promotion, he gets the news he always feared: no college degree means no promotion. In the face of this new reality, and lamenting the time he devoted to work over family, Tom and his wife Carol decide to change course and start a family business. They pack up their kids and move to a small town to take over a run-down garage bequeathed to them by Tom's estranged father.(n)

programme.title: The Longshots
programme.desc: A former high school football star gets his self-respect back when he lands a job coaching the local Pop Warner team with his athletically gifted niece as quarterback. Ice Cube stars in this sports comedy with Keke Palmer and Dash Mihok.(n)

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: A wedding is about to take place in Chinquapin, Louisiana. The bride is Shelby (Julia Roberts), a headstrong young beauty whose iron-willed mother, M'Lynn (Sally Field), would do anything for her. Giant-haired Dolly Parton is Truvy, the owner of the beauty parlor that serves as the town's unofficial hub. Dropping in to exchange gossip are Ouiser (Shirley MacLaine), the richest and meanest woman in town, and Clairee (Olympia Dukakis), an elegant widow with a sly delivery. Together they provide each other with strength and friendship.(n)

programme.title: Push (2009)
programme.desc: A clairvoyant teenager (Dakota Fanning) and a telekinetic fugitive (Chris Evans) team up to find a missing woman who is the key to exposing a sinister, secret government agency that's building a clandestine army of psychic warriors. Djimon Hounsou costars in this sci-fi action thriller.(n)

programme.title: The Debt
programme.desc: Academy Award winner Helen Mirren and Sam Worthington star in the story of Rachel Singer (Mirren), a former Mossad agent who endeavored to capture and bring to trial a notorious Nazi war criminal in a secret Israeli mission that ended with his death on the streets of East Berlin. Now, 30 years later, a man claiming to be the doctor has surfaced, and Rachel must go back to Eastern Europe to uncover the truth. Directed by Academy Award nominee John Madden.(n)

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Follows the extraordinary life of college football hero Ernie Davis (Rob Brown), the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy. His fight for equality forever changed the face of American sports. Based on a true story.(n)

programme.title: The Longshots
programme.desc: A former high school football star gets his self-respect back when he lands a job coaching the local Pop Warner team with his athletically gifted niece as quarterback. Ice Cube stars in this sports comedy with Keke Palmer and Dash Mihok.(n)

programme.title: The Express
programme.desc: Follows the extraordinary life of college football hero Ernie Davis (Rob Brown), the first African-American to win the Heisman Trophy. His fight for equality forever changed the face of American sports. Based on a true story.

programme.title: Major League II
programme.desc: The Indians are now a World Series contender. But last season's hunger is now replaced with complacency and bad decisions by the new owner that threaten to tear the team apart.

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds
programme.desc: A squadron of vengeful, Nazi-killing Allied soldiers becomes embroiled in a plot to firebomb a Parisian movie theater hosting a film premiere that Adolf Hitler plans to attend in this comically violent World War II action smash starring Brad Pitt, Diane Kruger and Oscar® winner Christoph Waltz.
